---
title: "Get daily price data from public sources"
author: "Eran Raviv"
date: "`r format(Sys.time(), '%d %B, %Y')`"
output: html_notebook
---

This is a short script to pull data from public sources, in this case from yahoo, but can also be from google finance.


```{r chunk0, eval= T, echo = T, results= "markup"}
# install.packages(quantmod) # if not yet installed
#Load library
library(quantmod)
sym = c('NOK', 'SESG.PA', 'CNA.L', 'BT') # get tickers
l <- length(sym) # set how many tickers
end <- format(Sys.Date(),"%Y-%m-%d") # end date is set for today
start<-format(as.Date("2000-01-01"),"%Y-%m-%d") # start in 2000, if data is available

list_price <- list() # make container for the prices

#  Loop through the prices
for (i in 1:l){
  list_price[[i]] = getSymbols(sym[i], src="yahoo", from=start, to=end, auto.assign = F)
}
# Print the first and last line of the list
for(i in 1:l){
print(head(list_price[[i]], 1))
print(tail(list_price[[i]], 1))
}
```
